Reviews.Title: “medium hotel, but good staff”
Reviews.Author: Jerome R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: - breakfast was a "sort of" - shower needs maintenance/to be repared - room ok for the price - But a real nice staff ... and I loved the cat

Reviews.Title: “great location, basic facilities”
Reviews.Author: Norman H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Amsterdam so unable to compare with other hotels. However I have been in a number of cities and found Amsterdam generally expensive. So with this in mind was 150 Euro a night for a three person room a few hundred yards from Dam Sq over the Easter weekend good value? I felt the room was poor, even dingy but it is in an old building full of character. Beds were clean and comfortable but towels were never changed or beds made during the 4 nights there. We asked for clean towels on day 3 and they were given. Some new decor and this place could be a winner as its location is near the Anne Frank museum and in a safe area with easy walking to so much of Amsterdam. The self service breakfast was excellent and the house cat was so friendly. One other comment on the church bells that ring through the night every half hour ! Lovely in daytime though. No sure of its star rating but more of a bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: clare h Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel due to budget, our hopes werent that high but we didnt expect it to be quite as bad.The bed sheets were clean but the rooms and hall ways were not. Also breakfast was only toast. However for the amount of time that we spent in the rooms it did the job, I would recommend this hotel if you are only goin to Amsterdam for a couple of days and plan to spend very little time in your room. Do not book this hotel if you will be having early nights and want breakfast included. Despite all of this the hotel staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Arnoud d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night in a single room. Location is excellent, great value for money. It is a bit run down, in the sense of some stains in the carpet, stuff like that. However, I am not too demanding, for the price it was great value for money. Friendly service, modest breakfast included. I would certainly recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No Hassle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrimalfantasyPage
Reviews.Content: We are just back from staying at this Hotel, after reading reveiews , We were dreading going , But were surprised to find Cheerfull helpfull staff... Its by no means the Ritz , but for what we paid for it and its location , couldnt ask for more... we were in the dreaded room 9, and yeah the floors are slanted, and its a bit run down, but beds were clean and you get extra bedding, we even got a sweet left on the pillows on arrival, and best of all you get an ashtray in your room and in the Dam this is a must...Cleaners were there everyday if you wanted anything, towels etc, Breakfast was scarambled eggs , toast, mini sausages, ham and cheese, perfect. Wet room shower worked great always hot water and heating was never off... So cant see why people are moaning to be honest, you get what you pay for , and for seeing Amsterdam, and being close to everything then we would recomend this Hotel and would stay there again for sure, so if your not expecting the Ritz then dont go . but if you want a good base no hassle, and breakfast then its for you .. Happy holidays ...

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: Kittysquee
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! My boyfriend booked this (unfortunately!) for us to stay in Amsterdam and it was terrible! We were led to believe that we had a double room which actually turned out to be a single. The card swipe door mechanism didn't work and one of the girls from reception came with a screwdriver and packet of batteries and was able to open the door that way. No en suite, we had to use the disgusting shared bathroom, most mornings I just got washed in the sink in the bedroom as it was horrible. We had a first floor room with single glazed windows windows didn't feel very secure and looked out onto bins. The floor of the room was uneven with one side of the room on an incline, as I have very bad reflux we had to lie with our heads at the foot of the bed. The bed linen was clean but the carpets not so much. I have stayed in quite a few hostels before which have been much nicer than this 'hotel'. Would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, disgusting rooms.”
Reviews.Author: desy-travelagent
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! PLEASE LISTEN TO THIS REVIEW.... I decided to give it a chance but I wished I had listened to the previous reviews.... Staff extremly rude, dirty beds, carpets etc. the place was filthy. If you have already booked I would advise to CANCEL and book somewhere else... I have stayed in some very basic accomodations in my time but this place is like a brothel/drug den. DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING VALUABLE IN YOUR ROOM!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Robertgh
Reviews.Content: Please be warned this is a hovel of a place feet stick to carpets doors do not lock windows don't shut and hanging out The bathrooms disgusting sink hanging of wall and this was a en suite one dread to think wot the shared one was like . . we didn't dare sleep there 12 o'clock fri we got there and she couldn't even get the door fixed be warned It's the worst place I've ever seen in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a snarl, room without a lock”
Reviews.Author: KnaveSharpener
Reviews.Content: Having arrived and tried to use the door intercom, the voice on the other end was hostile and aggressive. Even when I managed to establish that I'd a booking, there was no welcome, and the only friendly face I saw belonged to a large ginger cat. At least there was someone happy to see me. My room card was handed over, once I'd paid the EUR 20 "key deposit". (Since when did cheap mag-strip cards cost EUR 20 to replace?) I was warned about batteries in the door lock. Time to try the "key" in the street door lock. About five tries later, I got it to open. Having opened, it wouldn't lock again. So I went upstairs to my room. They weren't wrong about the room lock. The battery cover was missing, leaving the batteries exposed, and it simply didn't lock. There was no way of making it work, either. Color me unimpressed. Mine wasn't the only room whose lock had lost the battery cover, too. The room and bed at least looked clean, and probably were. The next job was to close the windows and shut out the gale outside. One of them eventually yielded to brute force. The other couldn't be made to close, let alone latch shut, despite best efforts. As it was directly above the head end of the bed, it was going to be a cold and drafty night. And if the wind was from the wrong direction, a wet one too. So much for security and comfort. The room was tiny, but I'm a frequent traveler to Amsterdam, so I was expecting that. There were towels provided (not fluffy by any stretch of the imagination, but not scratchy either). No soap, shampoo or any other human comforts. Strangely, there was a flat sachet of some kind of perfume, the sort that comes on magazine covers (and probably did). Fortunately, I'd brought shampoo with me, a bottle from a rather better hotel, which served as liquid soap for use with the washstand (the toilet and shower were communal). I laid down on the bed and surveyed the ceiling, in which a single light fitting appeared to bear every stain it accumulated since it had been installed. Somewhere in the 1970s, I'd guess. A dead moth completed the picture. Decor, both in the room and outside it in the accommodation common areas, was desperately in need of a refresh. Electric cables were mostly inside badly installed and cheap trunking untidily stuck or screwed to the wall. Plumbing was all there to see. The whole place felt run-down and neglected. I feared for my luggage, given the lack of security, so my trip out that evening was necessarily brief. Leaving, I did get the front door to latch, so I had a little hope that I'd come back to the same bags I left. Thankfully, I did. When I settled down to sleep, I discovered that the bed rocked really badly. No, that's not quite correct. The bed rocked really WELL. Thankfully, the telephone directory the hotel thoughtfully provided was just the right size to chock the bed leg, that and a book I'd brought with me. The mattress felt like an upholstered block of foam, and had only a thin sheet between me and it. Once I'd put on enough layers to insulate me from the cold draft from the part-open window above my head, I managed sleep of a sort. The following morning, I went down for the breakfast buffet. The lady on the front desk didn't even look up. The buffet, to give credit where due, was reasonable, and the breakfast room, which doubles as hotel reception, was light, nicely decorated and clean-looking, in marked contrast to the room areas next door. On display there were cereals, cheeses, meats, all of which looked fresh, and on the warmers were scrambled eggs, slightly dry beans and some fried sausage. Juices, coffee and tea were provided. It was only as I was heading to my chosen table that I saw what the cat (sleeping peacefully on a chair) had left underneath it. By this time, I felt like dropping my pants and doing the same. I picked a different table. Still, breakfast went down and stayed down. I handed over my "key", got my deposit back, and left the Belga, never to return. The only redeeming features of this hotel were the buffet and the free wi-fi. And the cat, although it could use a little toilet training.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucille106
Reviews.Content: Or I should say stay in this hotel if you don't mind having a visit every night from mice and some type of insect that bites you in bed. Or if you don't mind seeing dirty laundry bags in the hallways everyday. Bad lighting in rooms etc. etc. I could go on and on... The place needs an overall good remodeling and cleaning up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: watersev
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my second stay in Amsterdam and was surprisingly impressed. I had a three person room which ended up costing about 75 euro per night or 25 per person. The room was clean however the three single beds were pushed together creating an island bed. The bathroom was a bit small, but compared with the hostels in the city a much better value. Each morning there was a free breakfast which included eggs, some deli meats, cereal, juice, and tea/coffee. The staff was helpful and the location just a minute away from Dam Square was great.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: anniesGenova
Reviews.Content: In group with other three friends, we had the first problem with the room magnetic key, that didn't work leaving us outside all night long (our luggage was inside). The staff didn't manage to open it nor to call his boss to fix it. Our first night in Amsterdam has been horrible; we slept in another room, dirty and with only three beds (we were four). The boss didn't make us discounts for this event, and the whole bill was already paid at our arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and small hotel”
Reviews.Author: speedywerner
Reviews.Content: We went to hotel belga between 27-04-2010 and 2-05-2010 and had a create time, the rooms are dated but very clean and there is a nice breakfast buffet in the morning. The staff is helpful and the help you with everything if you want to go somewhere. The location is perfect in the center and everything on walking distains. And the queens day was nice the hall city was orange. We go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “They Steal your money”
Reviews.Author: jmondak
Reviews.Content: My Flight got canceled because of the Volcanic ash and they charged my credit card for all 3 days They would not give me my money back and when I contacted them I got this response. Dear Madame, Sir, We are sorry but we are not responsible for the nature disasters. We advice to contact you travel insurance for this matter.

Reviews.Title: “Thank god the rest of Amsterdam isn't like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gould321
Reviews.Content: Staff had little clue what was happening from the minute we got there. We arrived around 10am ish and they told us that we couldn't get into our room till past 1pm. So we had to leave all our bags on the hotels breakfast kitchen floor or wait with them till 1pm to put them in our rooms. The rooms are a joke. We came down for breakfast pretty early and was told that we was late and that food had already been put away.. We got rooms that over looked the hotels inside that was just filled with about 4 tons of rubish. If people are saying that "you get what you pay for" for a quickstop hotel like this then the hotel should be free! Would only recommend this hotel if you needed to catch some sleep for 4-5 hours then straight back out. Thats all we ended up using it for. After a long day/night in Amsterdam it is also quite a walk from the "heart" of the city. Good luck belga, you need it!

Reviews.Title: “SCARY Place needs a health inspector”
Reviews.Author: ynotUsa
Reviews.Content: Thirty years ago this place was cheap and clean. Thirty years ago I was better for wear as well. This hotel needs a health inspector. Toothpaste water in room glasses by the sink. You couldn't find more indifferent staff. The place was filthy and nobody cares. I'd be surprised if this hotel is not condemned in the future. Front desk girl was flat out drunk on the bench in front of the hotel on two separate nights. On a stack of bibles I swear.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had read the reviews - Don't stay here. Grotty Hotel Indifferent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: pepsbrown
Reviews.Content: As the title says, I really wish I had read the reviews on this site. I had seen some but taken them with a pinch of salt. Oops! We went to Amsterdam for my friends hen do. We thought for 45 euros each for a triple room, it would have been a decent hotel. We weren't expecting a luxury multiple star B&B, just something clean and nice. The one good thing about this hotel is the location; Jordann. This was a really nice location with lots of shops, restaurants, coffee shops and bars. That's where the 'good' ends I'm afraid. We arrived at the front desk and were told we had to pay the entire stay before we got into the room. The alarm bells should have started ringing here but we were excited to have arrived so paid up front. 5% charge for using any type of card which was never mentioned. We then went to the room and realised why they had asked us to pay up front. If I hadn't have paid I would have turned and walked out and found somewhere else to stay. The first thing you notice is the smell. The carpets were grotty, paint peeling off the walls and a random peice of material stuck up on one wall presumabley to cover up the great cracks in the walls. The bedding had loads of cigarette burns in it, only one of the lamps worked, the plugs sockets were literally hanging off the walls (in fact the TV was plugged into a very dodgy socket right next to the bedspread - fire waiting to happen). We were lucky enough to have a bathroom which i'm glad of because I've read about the communal shower. However, the towels were tiny, I would have said they were hand towels) . I'm quite small and would have expected a towel to actually fit round me, but no. The 'ensuite' had enough room for a shower and a toilet next to it. No room to manouvre at all or even shut the door if on the loo and taller than 5'2. One other thing, the doors often don't close properly so if you are daft enough to stay after reading all of the reviews, make sure you really check the door locks properly after you. Then we come to the service. The staff obviously don't care. We didn't get fresh towels or any other type of service for our 3 day stay. On the third day I asked (at reception because nobody was interested in answering the phone) for fresh towels. I remind her again 4 hours later that we wanted towels. She said that she would bring them up later. We got them at 11pm. Breakfast was ok, not too much to complain about other than the miserable guy on reception. I went down for breakfast at 9.30 one morning (it finishes very sharply at 10) Had a piece of toast, then asked for more bread at 9.55am. The guy was obviously unimpressed that I was asking for help when he was busy on the internet and responded " Breakfast is finished, if you had been down 20 minutes ago there would have been bread". Hilarious, since I had been there half an hour before and there was hardly any breakfast left at all. So in summary, if you want to be completely ripped off, stay in a place thats grotty and a health and safety disaster waiting to happen with miserable staff, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great location & a budget hotel....you get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: ryanfax
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Amsterdam for the weekend at the last minute, on a Thursday afternoon, therefore we were quite restricted in terms of hotel availability. There were just two friends and I travelling (male aged 24-26) that were looking only for a place to sleep, with a good location and as cheap as possible. That is certainly what we got from Hotel Belga. It is located within two blocks of Dam Square (approx 5 min stroll) and is set in a nice area, away from the hustle and bustle of the main areas. It cost us 50euros each per night (based on 3 people sharing a room). This was considerably cheaper than anthing else on offer at the time (baring in mind our last minute booking) The staff were very friendly on our arrival and took the time to mark areas of interest on a map and explain a few 'do's a dont's' to help us get the most from our stay. They also supplied a safety deposit box and allowed us to store our luggage in the back room before our departure on the last day. I can't comment on the breakfast as we never made it up in time to sample it! The room was very basic and the beds/pillows were a little hit and miss, the shower was cramped and poorly ventilated, the toilet was in the same tiny room as the shower, but these weren't issues for us on this particular trip. Don't get me wrong the hotel is basic and a little run-down, this is certainly not somewhere I would come with a family or partner, but for our purpose it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “An Inspector Calls (or should do!)”
Reviews.Author: Caro1London
Reviews.Content: Great location but as for the rest of the hotel it takes some beating! At least the sheets were clean (I checked first) and the shower had hot water, but apart from that I can't think of anything that would entice anyone to go and stay there. Not only is the place in dire need of some serious maintenance work and redecoration, but it smells awful, a kind of damp, musty, very unpleasant smell which permeates into your very soul. The area of carpet under the window in our room was totally soaked through from a leaking radiator. The toilet and shower was gross! Smelly, mildewy and falling apart. I was charged an extra 5 per cent for paying by card, which was not mentioned on the original booking. Most of the staff had a general don't-care kind of attitude. The rooms are not secure as judging by the marks around the locks they have obviously been broken into a number of times. This meant taking all our valuables with us every time we went out. I really do wonder how the place keeps on operating. If an inspector called I am sure it would be shut down immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest in it's kind, basic, but charming and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: kiekster
Reviews.Content: Although many reviews are negative about the quality, you must realise that Hotel Belga is one of the cheapest hotels's in it's kind. It offers you basic accomodation which is clean(!). Besides that the staff is great, they'll do anything to help you. From helping you out when you need a sleeping place at 5 a.m. (seriously, not many hotels would check you in!) Untill ensambling a personalised city tour for you, so you can skip all the crappy stuff. If you're looking for a cheap place to sleep in a part of the real amsterdam you've found the right place!

Reviews.Title: “On no account think of staying here”
Reviews.Author: GaryDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on the good review given to it by Time Out Amsterdam Guide. Sad to say that the Time Out review is inaccurate beyond belief. We were charged 121 euros a night for a room that resembled a homeless shelter. Once i had payed the first night up front (i should have known something was wrong when they asked me to pay by sending my bank details by e-mail), they had us over a barrel as they offer no refund for a room booked less than 30 days in advance. We looked at the room and we left!!! Â£400 for nothing, with no recourse to get our money back. Where to start.... the fragrence of urine in the hall, the unidentified stains on the bedding, the mould on the shower, the paint peeling from the walls, the dirty towels.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go To The Belga”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsDallas
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I were off for long weekend We had NEVER been to Amsterdam Before... We were BOTH very excited about going & "Celebrate" Our First wedding Anniversary. The Reviews & Pictures from on-line sources were not very accurate! We did spend Time checking out The Belga, but had NO idea How bad this Hotel truly was. Our Room was On Incredible slope, and I guess was weird to say the least while being a wee bit stoned...lol This should be Under name of Cheap Tacky Hostel.. In fact There are Cheaper, Cleaner & more friendly "Hostels" In Central Amsterdam! There were Holes In bed covers...And I was bitten many times by mysterious Wee Critters. FOR $100 euros Per Night Per Room.... we were Ripped off Big time. It will Not put us off going back to Amsterdam, but next time Not to The Belga:) Just glad we found Cafe round the corner "Rockland "serves great cakes & coffee..The Staff & customers were All Lovely People hope we see you soon! <<---We'll Be Beck from Mr & Mrs Dallas

Reviews.Title: “When I saw the room, I really wanted to turn around and go home”
Reviews.Author: Kat-the-Travel-Gnome
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this place for me. (I don't think I'll use her service ever again.) The Good: - Location - it was located between the 2 canals, easy access to many places - I walked everywhere. Location was safe and quiet at night too. - Includes breakfast in the morning The Bad (this is going to be a long list, you can skip to the UGLY part, if you wish): - No Toilet in the room - There was one in the hallway, shared between my room and another room - Narrow and steep stairs - my room happened to be on the highest floor - it was a work out getting my 24" luggage up those stairs - Broken security card reader lock - yup, just because they use security card access doesn't mean it's safe. My door reader was broken and wouldn't lock. I had to tell the "hotel" front desk guy to fix it. Even though it was working afterwards, every time I leave my room, I still felt nervous about other people breaking-in. - Ghetto bed + plywood headboard + sketchy bed sheets - I slept with clothes on, on top of the blankets. Enough said. - Small TV with broken remote. - Dirty/Sticky Old Phone - yeah, that would prevent people from calling the front desk The *UGLY*: - Shared Shower - it was shared between everyone in the hotel! It was small, dark. Light switch on outside the door (I swear I'd scream if someone turned it off while I was showering). The worst part was pulling the shower curtain, it was gross - filled with mildew. I tried not to touch the walls, I limited my movements... Oh yeah, if you don't have a pair of plastic slippers, don't even consider walking in... it was yucky. Thankfully, I only had to stay there for 2 nights, and then I was off to my next destination. I'd definitely will not go back again. I hope this review will help other travellers out there.

Reviews.Title: “our experience of the belga hotel”
Reviews.Author: memazzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belga hotel for my friends birthday and booked a basic room with no shower etc, however for the first night we were upgraded to a triple room with a shower. The room was a little shabby (big patches of paint had fallen off the walls!) and the bathroom tiny, but it was very clean. We had to vacate our room the next day, but weren't really bothered about that - the maid moved all our belongings to the next room, which was at the top of some very steep stairs! The second room was tiny but adequate and again clean. The shared shower was fun and games as you don't really have anywhere to put your clothes in order to keep them dry and you can't really put them on without getting wet!! I ended up going back to the room with a top on and towel round my waist!! With regards to the heating - we sussed that it was generally switched off, but you could turn the radiators on in both rooms by adjusting the thermostatic valve, however it then got too hot and we had to turn them off!! The breakfast buffet was basic but fine - different breads, gouda and meat. Also crackers, jam, pate etc and cereal. Fruit juice and hot drinks also provided. I was a little concerned about security as the front door was always open and our second room had obviously been broken into before as the door frame was all patched up! however we didn't ever feel unsafe. The location was very good and was quiet, although unfortunately for us there was a large very loud group of american girls staying, and the walls are very thin! Obviously the hotel can't do anything about this, but if people come in late you can hear doors slamming as you have to pull them hard to shut them properly. We went to the smallest pub in amsterdam a couple of times - just off dam square - the staff are very friendly and the drinks reasonably priced - i would def recommend it! Overall the Belga hotel was a pleasant experience and fine for what we wanted, if you are expecting a posh, modern 4 star hotel - you might want to stay somewhere else. Any questions feel free to ask

Reviews.Title: “seems to have new management”
Reviews.Author: fredSeattle_Wa
Reviews.Content: The Belga, our wonderful hotel that we have been staying in for 12-15 years has turned into a disaster . Its a small 10 room place in a great location at a very reasonable price. The location is still great but the two wonderful sisters who ran it for years seem to have vanished and the the new managment appears to be kids - either 20 something's or teenager boys who spend all their time watching the video cameras newly installed in the halls The shiny new cameras are an interesting update considering the rest of the mess. Interesting that security is such a concern to the manager since the hotel has an separate outside door on the street that goes up to the room and the manager disabled the card reader when it had a continuous malfunction so it was essentially wide open for days. Its always been a little shabby but clean; still shabby but with dirty windows, dirty curtains, grimy walls, dirty bedspreads, filthy carpets with obvious and recent food stains . The broken toilet paper holder presented a real problem since the bathroom was tiny and it featured the shower that drenches the entire bathroom; the toilet paper was always a bit "damp" - not to mention the 20 watt light bulb over the tiny sink (good thing I don't wear makeup). It was chilly in Amsterdam and our repeated request for heating never produced any, although one radiator did get slightly warm one day. But the absolute capper was the freshly dead, oozing, partially eaten dead mouse right in front of the breakfast buffet. The young "manager" that morning kept carefully stepping over the mouse until I requested that he remove it and he did but not with any good will. And, since Amsterdam was 100% booked for a convention we couldn't move but God knows I did try. And, be aware that they charge an additional 5% when you use a credit card , fair but not always disclosed when you book a room. It all makes me very sad since this has been my favorite hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Belga is all you need”
Reviews.Author: DaytripperNorthEast
Reviews.Content: The Belga is a family-run business comprising a cafe with a small hotel above, although the hotel has a separate entrance. We enjoyed our stay and found that the good things outweighed the not-so-good things. Other people have said that this is basic accommodation - and it is - but they keep it clean, give you fresh towels daily and there is plenty of hot water. We had an en-suite room, which was fine, but the shared facilities didn't look too inviting. The best thing about the Belga is the location, near Dam Sqare, Anne Frank's House etc., but in a lovely quiet street with no disturbance at night. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was fresh and plentiful - we found that we didn't need lunch. If you want problem-free accommodation in a great part of Amsterdam, for the price, this is absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “STAY WELL CLEAR OF THIS PLACE VERY NOISY VERY DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: nobleman
Reviews.Content: well ive just arrived back from amsterdam where i stayed at the hotel belga for three nights im not quite sure where to start the rooms were dirty with cracks in the walls bed sheets were all ripped and burn holes in them the desk they had in the room had been broken and repaired by stevie wonder . theres no toilets in the room or shower everything was on the landing outside shared with all the other guests.i used the shower once when i was there wich was filthy the shower curtain was mouldy and very worn.on a night it is impossible to get a nights sleep the noise is just unbeleivable not only from the guests coming back in at all hours of the night but the guy who works on the desk he had music playing all night very loud. the keys they give you are like acredit card wich you have to pay 20 euros for wich you get back at the end of your stay beware they dont work all the time twice we had to get the guy to let us in the room second time he took half an hour to let us in made us wait untill he was free.next time i will be staying somewhere else i advise you to do the same as you will be very dissapointed try the heart of amsterdam or the dam straat hotel this was my third visit to the city and it wont be the last sorry hotel belga but definetly not a 2 star hotel i would rate this as a hostel more than a hotel not good for couples or the elderly as there are no lifts and the stairs are very steep. the breakfasts were very average tea and coffee were in flasks not fresh and if you like ham sandwiches for your breakfast then your in luck.all in all there are a lot of hotels in amsterdam wich you can choose from for the same money take it from me put the hotel belga at the bottom of your list.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with all my fellow travellers”
Reviews.Author: cathhughes
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews for lots of hotels in Amsterdam I started to despair that we would ever find somewhere to stay. Once I read those of the Belga Hotel I was so relieved that noone could think of a single bad thing to say. And we totally agree. There is nothing bad to say. It's a great hotel, very helpful people, with a lovely breakfast, plus having a fantastic location. Very near Dam Square, but not hearing people passing duirng the night. I am so grateful to Trip Adviser for helping us to choose a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FOR the love of GOD DO NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: kiwipharmacist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week- The only good thing about it was its location. We booked this place through laterooms.com. I am on my O.E from Australia I have stayed in many accomodation styles from around the world. I swear this is the worst place I have ever stayed in. 1. Some of the staff could learn more about hospitality 2. The room was small and dirty 3. The bathroom was small and terrible! 4. I went to breakfast on the first two plates i picked up crusted food was still on it 5. There are two cats running around the hotel the hall way stank of cat urine 6. The cleaner cannot clean properly. 7 I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lillyvalley
Reviews.Content: Me and two of my female friends was staying at the hotel Belga on Oct 5- Oct 7 2006. Having read people's reviews on trip advisor about this hotel, we decided to go ahead and book it, as we found the price reasonable (shared between the 3 of us). Once we were there, we were pretty happy with the location. Our room was a good size with a double bed and a single. Having inspected the bedsheets, it seems pretty clean, so we were very happy with it. Bathroom was small, and it could do with better ventilation, but based on what we paid for I think the hotel is pretty good value, and I would definately choose to stay there again. The cafe provided good food too and their sandwiches are lovely and sold at a reasonable price. A good hotel for those looking for a clean hotel and for those on a budget! Location is 5 min from Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: pkd100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Belga for 2 nights in OCT/2006. Hotel Belga is ideally situated, a 5 minute walk away from Dam Square, in the pretty Jordaan area. The hotel itself, though not very comfortable, is good value for money. It is close to tram stops and the Anne Frank museum. We had booked a quad room, for four of us. The room was tiny without much walking area, but since we weren't anyways spending much time in the room, it wasn't a problem. The sheets and towels looked old but seemed clean. We had some problem with the lights not working the first evening, but it was attended to promptly by the staff. The toilet however was claustrophobic without any ventilation / exhaust. Breakfast consisted of cereals, bread, jam/butter, juice, tea/coffee, cakes, scrambled eggs and fruit, again quite sufficient if not the best. Once again, the best part is the location and the accessibility. Also, the lady in charge can do with some smile. Please note that Credit Card payments attract an extra 5% surcharge which is not very evident in the Accomodation Voucher.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KeiraH
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room in the Hotel Belga for my friend and I to enjoy Amsterdam for three nights in July. Because we were on a budget, we went for a room with no ensuite, which came to 252 euro for the room for three nights. The hotel itself is situated on a little side street about 7 mins walk to Dam Square and 10 mins to the Red Light District. It was well situated for local restaurants - I particularly recommend Il Panorama, an Italian cafe just 2 mins down the road. The reception area had a small cafe-like area and two very friendly cats. We were given a pass card for the front door and our room, which was on the first floor up a steep (but not too bad for Amsterdam standards!) flight of stairs. The decor in this area was basic but clean. Our room was a small double with a washbasin, two chairs, desk, bed and built in wardrobe. It was again basic but clean. The toilet was in a small understairs cupboard just outside the room and the shower was down the hall. Both communal facilities were perfectly adequate and very clean. Overall, we really enjoyed the stay. If you're the sort of person who spends hours in their hotel room, you probably wouldn't like the Belga. But if, like us, it's just a base for your weekend, it'd be great. The hotel's best feature was its staff - they bent over backwards to be helpful and looked after my friend's and my bags for the day before our flight, and even my boyfriend's even though he wasn't even staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel belga for 4 nights. When i first walked in i was gobsmacked the room looked terrible the colours didnt match but on closer inspection it was found to be clean and tidy. We had the room right at the top and the stairs were steep but the view was nice and it gave us something to look at. Didnt think much to the breakfast but im a bit fussy anyway. The staff were ok too. Would definatly recommend this hotel for the location and the cheapness. Would stay again for sure..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we got there our rooms were not ready. They let us keep our bags there so we could site see a little bit. When we returned we had something to eat (breakfast and lunch is served downstairs). You also get a discount on food if you are a guest. We then had to walk up 2 long flights of stairs... Once we got to our room it was clean with 3 beds and a window that opened. The bathroom (shower and toilet) were in a bathroom room and the sink was in the room. The security was great, you had to have a card to get into the hotel. Agree with the spring doors but they closed after you so you knew only guests were in the building. The two sisters who run the hotel are very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast downstairs every morning and the bagels are yummy. From our room we could hear them laughing it was a great sound. There are little things I could complain about but just the overall experience staying in Amsterdam in a central location made it all worth it. The only thing I can say is if you are looking for bell hops and room service don't stay here. Thank you ladies for a great stay and awesome bagels. Remember the Beef Stew!

Reviews.Title: “small and neat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny but very functional. It was clean and tidy and i didn't detect any bad smells as another reviewer did - and I'm very sensitive to smells. Helpful, friendly staff. It was in an excellent location, central and in the western canal belt which i found to be one of the most pleasant walking areas in Amsterdam. My only complaint is that the doors in the hotel all had those springloads on them which made them slam noisily shut, not great when you're trying to sleep at 2 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and basic”
Reviews.Author: BarnsleyTyke
Reviews.Content: Group of 14 travelled to Amsterdam for a stag do and settled at the Belga! Location, about 15 mins walk from the Central station, or a 10 Euro taxi ride. The hotel in itself was generally ok. Rooms basic (bed, tv, table and chair). Shower and toilet also in room. Beds were comfy, if only for the few hours sleep that we had. If one thing, the rooms were very cold and most people slept with jumpers on because it was that bad! Hotel is more than ideal for a group of lads, but if taking the lady, best to pay that little bit extra and get somewhere more up market.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK - cheap, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there a few times. The location is great, breakfast is fair enough. Room was tiny, but clean. Wouldn't want to be there in a fire as the wondows had bars on them. Steep stairs - no kidding. BUt only 3 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ayoung22
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a centrally located, budget hotel then Belga should definitely be at the top of your list! It's easy to get to from Central Station and its right in the middle of everything. A short walk from everywhere. It's not a luxury hotel by any means, but if you are just looking for a clean place to sleep at night, then Belga is a great choice. The breakfast buffet in the morning was always enough to get our day started and the staff was always super friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again and will recommend to others who are looking for budget accomodations in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby.. Bad hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nykevins
Reviews.Content: The lobby and breakfast buffet were nice but the room was really depressing with low ceilings... We were set way in the back of the hotel... For the amount we paid (95 euro/night) I thought we could have gotten a MUCH nicer room. We were in an attic. WIth one small window. My wife and I were backpacking and are not the picky type at all but this one was bad. Our beds were really uncomfortable and had stains on the covers... The cover on one of the beds had a huge rip in it. The bathroom smelled moldy/musty.. Rugs were really gross... Location was the only good thing.. I would look elsewhere if you need lodging in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean, friendly and cheap”
Reviews.Author: underground
Reviews.Content: I live in Amsterdam but was living temporarily in London and stayed here often when I would make trips back as it is in my neighbourhood. For the money you get a very central location, genuine friendliness and reasonable comfort. A nice basic and always very clean hotel in the heart of the city at a good price, and the fact that there is a separate entrance to the bedrooms means you can come and go as you please.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stsyed at the Hotel Belga after a recommendation by as friend. After an easy booking process, through the web, we recieved e-mails from teh owners with clear directions, and an outline of the facitilites etc. The hotel was easy to reach from the airport, we got the train to the centre and tehn a tram to a few roads away from pour destination. The hotel is abotu a 3 minute walk from Dam Square, we couldn't have asked for a better location from which to explore the city. The hotel was clean and all the staff were really friendly (and spoke great English, which was a great help to our non-dutch speaking party! The rooms were speacious, and the buffet breakfast was great - a selection of cold meats, bread, cereals, and gorgeous scrambled egg, which set you up for the day. There was no problem with rolling in at 4 in the morning as you have a key to the hotel. We plan to go back to Amsterdam again in September and will stay at Hotel Belga again.
